1.description: A young girl from the village of Bad Ass in the Ramtop Mountains. Born in unusual circumstances during a thunderstorm.

2.description: Shows unusual abilities and an inquisitive nature. Granny Weatherwax takes a special interest in her development.

5.description: Reveals remarkable magical potential that doesn't fit conventional patterns. Her abilities manifest in unexpected ways.

10.description: Demonstrates abilities that challenge traditional boundaries between different types of magic.

15.description: Becomes the first person to bridge different magical traditions, proving that talent transcends conventional limitations.

2.description: The village witch of Bad Ass, known for her practical approach to magic and her no-nonsense attitude. Commands respect and fear in equal measure.

5.description: Possesses incredible magical power but believes strongly in using the right tool for the right job. Has strong opinions about the proper order of things.

10.description: Infiltrates Unseen University to protect Esk, showing her resourcefulness and determination to challenge established traditions.

15.description: Proves that wisdom and determination can overcome prejudice and tradition. Earns grudging respect from the wizards.

6.description: A young wizard student at Unseen University. Intellectual and studious, with a particular interest in magical theory.

10.description: Becomes caught up in dangerous magical experiments. His theoretical knowledge sometimes exceeds his practical wisdom.

15.description: Learns the importance of balancing knowledge with wisdom, and theory with practical application.

8.description: The Archchancellor of Unseen University, leader of all the wizards. A traditionalist who believes in maintaining the established order.

12.description: Faces unprecedented challenges to traditional wizard authority and must adapt his thinking to new circumstances.

15.description: Learns to accept new ideas and approaches, showing that even the most traditional leaders can evolve.

1.description: An elderly wizard who arrives in Bad Ass during a thunderstorm, seeking to pass on his staff before dying. Sets events in motion with his final act.
The village blacksmith of Bad Ass, a practical man skilled in his trade. Father to several children including Esk.
Wife of the village smith and mother to Esk and her siblings. Present during the unusual circumstances of Esk's birth.
One of Esk's older siblings, son of the village smith. A typical village boy learning the family trade.
Another of Esk's siblings, part of the large smith family in Bad Ass village.
One of the smith's children, Esk's sibling who lives in the mountain village of Bad Ass.
The youngest of the smith's children, Esk's little brother who is still quite small.
The old wise woman of Bad Ass village, skilled in birthing and traditional healing. Present at Esk's unusual birth.

3.description: An elderly witch who lives in the mountains. One of the local magical practitioners that Granny Weatherwax consults about Esk's situation.
Another local witch in the Ramtops region. Part of the informal network of magical practitioners that Granny Weatherwax belongs to.

8.description: The Bursar of Unseen University, responsible for administrative matters. A nervous wizard who worries about regulations and proper procedures.
A professor at Unseen University, one of the senior faculty members. Specializes in theoretical magic and university politics.
A wizard at Unseen University, one of the faculty members involved in university governance and magical instruction.
A senior wizard at Unseen University. One of the more conservative faculty members who supports traditional approaches to magic.
A wizard instructor at Unseen University who teaches younger students in magical theory and practice.
The Librarian of Unseen University's magical library. An unusual figure who manages the dangerous books with special expertise.

5.description: Leader of a Zoon trading caravan traveling the Circle Sea region. A practical merchant with knowledge of roads and trade routes.
Son of the Zoon patriarch, learning the family trading business. Helps manage the caravan's operations and deals with travelers.
Captain of the guards protecting the Zoon caravan during their travels. Experienced in dealing with road dangers and bandits.

6.description: A trader from the distant land of Howondaland, traveling with exotic goods and stories from far-off places.
A merchant specializing in spices from Klatch, known for the quality and variety of his wares.
A trader in fine silks from the Agatean Empire, dealing in luxury goods for wealthy customers.

5.description: The cook for the Zoon caravan, responsible for feeding the travelers and maintaining supplies during the journey.
The chief driver of the Zoon caravan wagons, experienced in managing the animals and navigating difficult terrain.

7.description: One of many workers at the bustling docks of Ankh-Morpork, loading and unloading ships and river barges.
A fish seller in Ankh-Morpork's markets, dealing with the catch brought in by fishing boats on the River Ankh.
A bread maker in Ankh-Morpork who supplies fresh bread to locals and visitors to the great city.
One of Ankh-Morpork's many beggars, skilled in the art of soliciting charity from passersby in the city streets.
A pickpocket and small-time criminal operating in the crowded streets and markets of Ankh-Morpork.
Owner and operator of a tavern in Ankh-Morpork, serving drinks and meals to locals and travelers.
A serving woman in an Ankh-Morpork tavern, experienced in dealing with rowdy customers and city life.

8.description: The gatekeeper at Unseen University who controls access to the grounds and monitors who enters and leaves.
One of the domestic staff at Unseen University, responsible for cleaning, cooking, and maintaining the facilities.
Maintains the grounds and gardens of Unseen University, dealing with both ordinary plants and magical specimens.

9.description: A young wizard student in his first year at Unseen University, still learning basic magical principles.
A wizard student with a year of experience at the University, beginning to understand more complex magical theories.
An advanced student wizard who has progressed significantly in his magical education and helps teach younger students.

11.description: Dangerous entities from beyond normal reality that are attracted to magical disturbances and seek to enter our world.
The fundamental structure of existence itself, which can be damaged or altered by careless or powerful magic.

3.description: One of the senior villagers in the Lancre region, respected for wisdom and experience in mountain life.
A mountain farmer working the difficult terrain of the Ramtops, growing crops and raising livestock.
A shepherd tending flocks in the high pastures of the Ramtop Mountains, knowledgeable about mountain weather and terrain.

1.description: The local drunkard of Bad Ass village, known for spending time at the tavern and having opinions about everything.
The proprietor of the tavern in Bad Ass village, serving drinks to locals and the occasional traveler.

4.description: A traveling merchant who trades goods between the mountain villages and larger towns, familiar with dangerous mountain paths.

6.description: Captain of a boat traveling the rivers between towns, transporting goods and passengers along the waterways.
The crew members of a river boat, experienced in handling the vessel and dealing with river hazards.
Operates a ferry crossing on one of the rivers, helping travelers cross safely for a fee.

5.description: Guards a bridge or road crossing, collecting tolls from travelers and merchants who pass through.
A troll who lives under a bridge, following the traditional troll occupation of challenging travelers who wish to cross.
Leader of a group of highway robbers who prey on travelers and merchants along the roads.
One of the bandits in a highway robber gang, following the leader in attacking travelers for their goods.

7.description: A person who claims to see the future and tells fortunes to customers in Ankh-Morpork's markets.
One of the city workers who cleans the streets of Ankh-Morpork, a necessary but thankless job in the great city.
A guard who patrols the streets of Ankh-Morpork at night, trying to maintain some semblance of order.
A woman who works in the clothing trade in Ankh-Morpork, skilled in sewing and mending garments.

9.description: A senior wizard or administrator who provides guidance to students at Unseen University about their studies and career paths.

8.description: Maintenance staff at Unseen University responsible for repairs, cleaning, and upkeep of the magical buildings.
Cooks and kitchen workers at Unseen University who prepare meals for the wizards, faculty, and students.
Tends the gardens and green spaces at Unseen University, dealing with both mundane and magical plants.

7.description: Operates a stall in Ankh-Morpork's markets, selling various goods to locals and visitors to the city.
An official in Ankh-Morpork's government, responsible for legal matters and maintaining civic order.
An administrative worker in Ankh-Morpork's bureaucracy, handling paperwork and official business.
A religious figure serving at one of Ankh-Morpork's many temples, ministering to the spiritual needs of citizens.
A young person training in religious service at one of Ankh-Morpork's temples, learning ceremonial duties.

9.description: Oversees student housing at Unseen University, ensuring discipline and proper conduct in the dormitories.

10.description: A faculty member at Unseen University who specializes in testing new magical theories and applications.

9.description: A university professor who focuses on the theoretical aspects of magic rather than practical applications.
A teacher at Unseen University who instructs students in the hands-on application of magical skills.
A scholar at Unseen University who specializes in the history of magic and ancient civilizations.

8.description: Helps the Librarian manage Unseen University's vast collection of magical books and manuscripts.

12.description: A magical construct or entity that protects important areas of Unseen University from unauthorized access.

7.description: A specialized trader in Ankh-Morpork who sells ingredients and materials needed for magical spells.

8.description: A former wizard who has retired from active magical practice but still lives near Unseen University.
A traveling academic who visits Unseen University to share knowledge and learn from the faculty.

7.description: A practitioner of alchemy working in Ankh-Morpork, creating potions and conducting chemical experiments.
A person knowledgeable in herbs and natural remedies, selling healing plants in Ankh-Morpork's markets.
A craftsperson who creates scrolls and parchments, some of which are used for magical purposes.
A merchant specializing in various types of ink, including special inks used for magical writing.

8.description: Carries messages and documents between different parts of Unseen University and to external locations.
Manages the financial affairs of Unseen University, overseeing budgets and expenditures.
Administrative assistant who handles correspondence and scheduling for University officials.

10.description: A wizard who specializes in developing and analyzing magical spells for the University's research programs.

8.description: A student training to assist in managing the magical library at Unseen University.
Guards who patrol Unseen University during nighttime hours, watching for intruders and magical disturbances.

10.description: A craftsperson who creates magical items and enchanted objects for use at the University.

9.description: A faculty member who teaches philosophical aspects of magic and the theoretical underpinnings of magical practice.
Teaches mathematical concepts related to magical calculations and spell formulation.
A medical practitioner who treats injuries and illnesses at Unseen University, familiar with magical ailments.

14.description: Oversees the graduation ceremonies and academic requirements for students completing their studies.

13.description: Records important events and decisions at Unseen University for historical preservation.

1.description: A young person learning the blacksmithing trade under Esk's father in Bad Ass village.
Assists Gammer Beavis with births in the mountain villages, experienced in traditional healing practices.

3.description: Tends goats in the high mountain pastures around Bad Ass and neighboring villages.

1.description: The local woodworker in Bad Ass village, skilled in furniture making and building repair.
Creates cloth and textiles for the mountain village, working with wool from local sheep.
Operates the mill that grinds grain for Bad Ass village and surrounding farms.

2.description: Specializes in making cheese from goat and cow milk in the mountain village.
Hunts game in the mountains to supplement the village food supply, knowledgeable about mountain wildlife.
Elderly villager who knows the old tales and legends of the Ramtop Mountains.

3.description: A wandering craftsman who repairs pots, pans, and metal goods in mountain villages.

4.description: Experienced in navigating the dangerous paths of the Ramtop Mountains, helps travelers find safe routes.

5.description: Manages the mules, donkeys, and oxen that carry goods for the trading caravan.
Second in command of the caravan guards, assists the captain in organizing security.
Rides ahead of the caravan to check for dangers, bandits, and suitable camping spots.

6.description: Travels with the caravan selling swords, knives, and other weapons to guards and traders.
Deals in precious stones, rings, and ornamental jewelry from various lands.
Crafts leather goods including bags, belts, and protective gear for caravan members.

5.description: Specializes in making strong ropes and cords needed for securing cargo and climbing.

6.description: Trades in ceramic pots, bowls, and decorative pottery from various regions.
Creates glass bottles, windows, and decorative items, carrying fragile wares carefully packed.
Specializes in dyeing fabrics in bright colors using traditional and exotic dyes.
Creates intricate carpets and rugs, prized for their craftsmanship and beauty.
Distills fragrances and perfumes from flowers and exotic ingredients for wealthy customers.
Crafts flutes, drums, and stringed instruments, often entertaining the caravan in the evenings.

5.description: Treats sick and injured animals in the caravan, knowledgeable about animal diseases and remedies.
Manages supplies and provisions for the caravan, ensuring everyone has food and necessities.

7.description: Collects taxes and fees from merchants and residents of Ankh-Morpork for the city government.
Inspects goods entering Ankh-Morpork and collects customs duties from traders and merchants.
Commands a trading vessel that docks at Ankh-Morpork's busy harbor, bringing goods from distant ports.
Crew member on a trading ship, experienced in sailing and handling cargo at the city docks.
A street performer who walks on ropes and performs acrobatic feats to entertain crowds.
A performer who demonstrates knife-throwing skills as street entertainment in the city.
A street entertainer skilled in juggling multiple objects to amuse passersby and earn coins.
A dramatic performer who eats fire and breathes flames as a dangerous form of street entertainment.
A silent performer who acts out scenes without words, working the streets for donations.
An artist who paints portraits of citizens and visitors for a fee in the city markets.
Crafts and repairs shoes and boots for the citizens of Ankh-Morpork, skilled in leather work.
Produces candles and oil lamps to provide lighting for homes and businesses in the city.
Creates soap and cleaning products for the hygiene needs of Ankh-Morpork's residents.
Imports and sells wines from various regions, catering to taverns and wealthy customers.
Brews beer and ale in Ankh-Morpork, supplying the numerous taverns and inns throughout the city.
Sells various types of cheese in Ankh-Morpork's markets, importing from dairy regions.
Deals in wheat, barley, and other grains, supplying bakers and brewers in the city.
Sells fresh and dried fruits in the city markets, bringing produce from farming regions.
Offers fresh vegetables and herbs to city residents, sourced from nearby farms.
Butcher who sells fresh meat to city residents, dealing with livestock from rural areas.

8.description: Tests prospective students seeking admission to Unseen University, ensuring they meet academic standards.

9.description: Enforces rules and regulations at Unseen University, dealing with student misconduct and violations.

8.description: Maintains and distributes the ceremonial robes worn by faculty and students at formal university functions.
Rings the university bells to mark class times, meals, and important events throughout the day.
Manages all the keys for doors, rooms, and locked areas throughout Unseen University.
Cares for horses and other animals kept by Unseen University for transportation and research.

9.description: Studies weather patterns and atmospheric conditions as they relate to magical phenomena.

8.description: Tests food for safety before it is served to university faculty, important due to magical contamination risks.

2.description: Collects medicinal and culinary herbs from the mountain slopes around Bad Ass village.

10.description: Works the night shift in the magical library, dealing with books that are more active after dark.

recaps.1: An elderly wizard named Drum Billet arrives at the remote mountain village of Bad Ass during a thunderstorm. He visits the local smith's family, where the smith's wife is in labor, and performs a final magical act before dying, setting mysterious events in motion.
recaps.2: Young Eskarina Smith begins displaying unusual abilities that worry the villagers. Granny Weatherwax, the village witch, takes notice of the child and decides to investigate the strange circumstances surrounding her birth and development.
recaps.3: Granny Weatherwax consults with other local witches about Esk's peculiar situation. The witches discuss the unusual nature of the child's gifts and the implications for traditional magical practice in their mountain community.
recaps.4: Esk's abilities continue to manifest in unexpected ways, challenging conventional understanding of how magic works. Granny Weatherwax decides that the child needs specialized training that goes beyond traditional witch knowledge.
recaps.5: Granny Weatherwax and Esk set off on a journey, joining a Zoon trading caravan headed toward Ankh-Morpork. During the travels, they encounter various merchants, traders, and the challenges of life on the road.
recaps.6: The caravan continues its journey toward the great city, with Esk learning about the wider world beyond her mountain village. The travelers face various obstacles and meet people from different lands and cultures.
recaps.7: The group reaches Ankh-Morpork, the greatest city on the Disc. Esk experiences the overwhelming bustle of urban life, with its crowds, markets, and countless different people pursuing various trades and occupations.
recaps.8: Granny Weatherwax and Esk arrive at Unseen University, the premier institution of magical learning. They encounter the rigid hierarchy and traditions of the wizards, who have very specific ideas about who can and cannot practice magic.
recaps.9: Esk begins attending classes at Unseen University as an unusual student. She meets other students, including Simon, and starts learning about formal magical education while challenging traditional assumptions.
recaps.10: Tensions arise at the University as Esk's presence disrupts established traditions. Her unconventional approach to magic creates conflict with faculty members who believe in maintaining strict boundaries between different types of magical practice.
recaps.11: Magical experiments at the University go dangerously wrong, creating threats that endanger both the institution and reality itself. The rigid adherence to tradition proves inadequate to handle the emerging crisis.
recaps.12: The crisis deepens as dangerous forces from beyond normal reality begin to intrude into the world. Both traditional wizard magic and conventional witch wisdom seem insufficient to address the growing threat.
recaps.13: Granny Weatherwax and the University faculty must work together despite their philosophical differences. The situation requires unprecedented cooperation between different magical traditions to prevent catastrophe.
recaps.14: The climactic confrontation requires all parties to abandon their preconceptions and work together. Traditional boundaries between different types of magic prove to be artificial limitations rather than natural laws.
recaps.15: The crisis is resolved through the combination of different magical approaches, proving that talent and wisdom matter more than rigid adherence to tradition. The University must adapt to a new understanding of magical practice and accept changes to their ancient ways.
